title: Chromas, Yorick and Champ Mastery in Ask Riot

replies.body:
> We want to maintain mastery levels 6 and 7 as achievements specific to high performance in competition, so they will only be achievable in SR modes.

Let me get this straight -  I can get a Level 7 Mastery for spamming {{champion:35}} on URF, but I can't even get a Level 1 Mastery for mastering a champion on Twisted Treeline or playing them over and over again on ARAM?

You can come up with a Champion Mastery grading system for half a dozen Featured Game Modes, but still haven't managed to come up with one for 2/3rds of your Permanent features?

That's completely backwards! Scrap mastery from Rotating Game Modes completely and double down on getting ARAM and Twisted Treeline Mastery! I don't care how much I played Shaco in URF, I'm not magically better with him now because URF was on Summoners Rift!

Adding onto this, 
>Mastery level 6 and 7 have a higher competitive bar as far as performance requirements. Alternate game modes are intended to offer variety in play with a less competitive standard for players. **We want to maintain mastery levels 6 and 7 as achievements specific to high performance in competition**, so they will only be achievable in SR modes. 

what about ranked Treeline? Is Riot seriously saying that normal blind SRs have a "higher competitive bar" than ranked 3s?
Yes.
all hail 3v3s !! {{champion:8}}
it makes me sad since I worked really hard to get my mmr in 3's had a game with Meteos a while back it was fun
I got {{champion:69}} to level 6 JUST for playing URF alone on one weekend. So yeah, I'm scratching my head a bit after I read their contradictory explanation.

How?
Lvl 6 masteries weren't out during URF weekened.
The last one, yes it was. It was just last week or the week before.
It gets better: You can get Level 5 mastery from playing Poro King, but you can't get Level 1 from playing ARAM. Even though they are almost exactly the same mode.

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}} all of the champion mastery i have is from playing URF as i find only urf to be fun, and aram isn't too horribly slow. it's really pathetic when it's been over a year and aram still doesn't have mastery. it's just vanity. it's not like the world will end if people have mastery from something else than the dull and boring summoner's rift.
yep, was level 5 with shaco before urf, level 7 after a day of urf xD

"ARAM and TT are very different from SR, so a special set of rules had to be developed to measure and rate player performance in those modes."
But random game modes with insanely different rules got mastery implemented in them when they released?
If you can't figure out how to assign mastery properly in game modes with more known variables, how could it have been ready for all the random modes in RGM?
Yeah, I feel like they kinda contradicted themselves there. I still don't understand how Poro King and Hexakill: TT gets a mastery system first before the regular game mode of ARAM and regular TT.

I'm really looking forward to a {{champion:82}} visual (and possible audio) update to put him in line with many of the other champs in League, a.k.a., no triangle feet (or breaking the 4th wall). Based on the info here, I can't imagine any date on something like that, but is it something that may be considered/in the works?

Thanks in advance!

Mordekaiser is on our list to get a full Visual & Gameplay update one day, probably the size of Taric/Sion. We feel like the Death Knight Thematic is very strong and we aren't delivering on it very well right now. We aren't actively working on it right now though, but he is definitely on our list!
and Cho'Gath? is he on that list.
He is, yes

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=uTEZqLz9,comment-id=000c0000000e0000,timestamp=2016-06-03T18:22:08.619+0000)
>
> He is, yes

So if we get about 4 full reworks this year? Can we expect an even greater number next year?

Not even sure if 4 will be the number this year. Could be more could be less. Different champions take different amounts of time. Yorick being a "Minionmancer" for example has a higher scope then most champions. Some champions like Gangplank or Ryze took less resources since we didn't feel as much needed to change. 

The point I'm making is attaching a number is hard since it's unclear how long/short different projects will take, just saying that we have a bigger team now and are trying to increase the cadence of our big VGUs.

So I was wondering if you could answer something that I haven't been able to get a clear response to, Reav, and to me you're one of the best Rioters when it comes to responding. If Swain isn't planned to get a VU for a long time, say, until 2018, then he should be up for a skin, yes? But I also see some Rioters saying they'd rather wait until he's gotten a VU, because they say his rig is too old. Then which is it? Does this mean Swain's going to have to wait a long time for any kind of skin, even after we've waited four years since his last one? It seems like if a champion is in such a need of a VU that they can't get a new skin at all, that they'd be high on the list of champions soon to get a VU. Even Mordekaiser, a champion with one of the oldest models in the game, and who is apparently on the list of champs looking to get a VU, got a 750 RP skin last year that is honestly pretty cool. Couldn't Swain get something like that, one that wouldn't be too much of a hassle to change come his far-off VU, but would still come soon enough that Swain mains won't have to wait even more years for something?

Sorry, Brutusness, wish I could give you a better answer. I can't really speak for the skins team though. I know that they tend to avoid champions that are high on our list for big updates though. It's not a trivial amount of work for Champion Update to remake the skins from scratch. 

What I can say is that Swain is pretty high on our list to get to. I wouldn't expect him this year but there's a high chance we could get to him sometime next year.

Just curious to know if  {{champion:17}} , {{champion:42}} , {{champion:45}} , {{champion:85}} , {{champion:68}}  will still get some love in regards to a visual update someday soon? Tristana, Poppy and Heimer were all made much more popular since their reworks and would be nice to see how the other Yordles will fair as well.

On day we will most likely get to those. I can see {{champion:42}} and {{champion:85}} making it onto the full VGU list in the next couple of years. Overtime champions that look good now start to look more and more dated, so it's hard to say who will be on the list 3-4 years from now.
Teemo is a potato. Actually, he looks dumb enough to be defined a popato instead.

My thought on those:

{{champion:3}} I think he should definetly become a warden(though mage could be his secondary role) as his whole lore basically is about how he is supposed to shield others.I'd also hope that his ability to turn into stone will be kept in some way since its just so fitting for a gargoyle.


{{champion:50}} The mage update helped to nail the "strategist"-theme a bit better(and the warlock theme was already fitting before),but his W still feels really clunky(and like a much worse version of Sorakas E).I really hope he'd get his update next year mainly because I think a vampire swain skin is something that has to be made for a halloween skin eventually.


{{champion:6}} yeah the poor guy still didn't get one,I kinda feel pity that he has to be in such a bad state for so long


{{champion:31}} I feel like cho'gath isn't terrible right now,but he has so much potential that he just doesn't use.Though I hope he doesn't get turned into a mindless killer machine,maybe something more like smaug(at least once he is big enough),in that he is brutal and evil,but still intelligent.


{{champion:39}} Again I think she doesn't use her full potential I mean she is this champ with levitating blades but her kit barely uses that.(also her character feels kinda bland).

{{champion:28}} I think she is one of the champs in the game whose general theme is one of the weakest,I mean she is pretty much just an "evil sexy woman",which isn't really anything special,especially since we already have another evil redhead from the shadowisles with elise.
Her kit also feels all over the place with lots of abilities that fit a fighter(or even tank) much better.


{{champion:82}} would love to see an update,since the last one kinda failed and in terms of visuals he is one of the last champs who still have pizza feet.
Though I think his character and lore are already pretty solid thanks to his updated story.


{{champion:80}} Similar to morde he is one of the few champs with oversized feet.
And a VGU could do wonders for him in terms of character since his new lore barely gives us any information about his personality.

{{champion:33}} While I think he isn't that bad in terms of visuals or gameplay he isn't really great either as his gameplay is kinda monotone.

{{champion:36}} could really need an update.His kit feels rather boring and I think his personality has the potential to be very interesting(his kinda goofy character creates a nice contrast to his brutal and sadistic personality,which could be explored)

{{champion:20}} He is honestly my least favorite character right now,largely because not only his character is rather uninteresting,but also because his kit seems to be kinda all over the place and is rather unimpressive.

{{champion:84}} I think thematically she is one of the weakest characters in the game(together with Evelynn).I mean her big theme is that she is a kunoichi,which basically means that the only thing that sets her apart from the other ninjas is the fact that she is a woman(at least kennen has the honor of being THE electro champ of the game).
And storywise she feels like she is simply Shens sidekick(though kennen suffers from the same problem)
What about {{champion:28}}
Yup! She's on the list as well. I would say she is higher priority then Morde, though not sure when we will get to her.

Since 6.11 now marks a full season of no balance updates for TT will riot announce they are overhauling it or removing it at the end of season 6 it harbors things such as team sellers, reward sellers, scripters, etc. 

In the current way TT is I don't see it ever being balanced as it always recieves balance updates from SR which are not meant to be on TT since you have less champions these numbers are not always the greatest for the map.

In 6.9 riot did a change to jungle experience [jungle monsters no longer share experience based on range only experience to killer] killing a meta that 3v3  had called support meta where it was 2 top ADC+Support and 1 AP bot.

When season 6 started 3v3 MMR was also changed so it was fairly easy to place diamond I if you have high MMR from last season you would place it 5-0 while the teams that were placed could only place a max of Silver I (This was highly likely a bug but riot doesn't put resources into 3v3)
Sorry, but I am on the ChampUp team, can't really answer any TT questions.

Is there any plan to increase the momentum of Champion reworks? 

There's a lot of characters that need attention, and few releases per year. At this rate we won't even get to see a dozen reworks by the time League is 10 years old.

I think you will find that we have been increasing the momentum by quite a bit. The time between Poppy and Taric was much shorter then previous VGU's. We have Ryze and Yorick in the pipeline right now as well. Even if we only got those 4 out this year that would be way more big VGU's then we have ever released in one year.

Not likely. It doesn't even feel right anymore with the elemental dragons. Morde just gets a generic dragon pet instead.
um? I mean, there's a clear difference in each elemental's ghost version's attacks. If anything, since the elemental dragons, Morgekaiser's pet dragons fit far better.

_"This is the point in production where it is very possible for a champion to get iceboxed if we can’t come up with something solid."_

I am super excited to see a much needed updated {{champion:83}} But there is a chance of his rework being scrapped D= but why? I'm sure riot can come up with something, they can't just scrap {{champion:83}} He is the biggest pun in league of legends, I hope that is being considered in his rework as well D=

What I was saying in the post is that Yorick is far past that point. I was saying that we have other champions that we haven't talked about yet that are at that point. Once we add a champion to the update schedule and start talking about them there is a pretty small chance of them getting iceboxed. It is always possible though as we would never release something we didn't think was high quality, it is just very unlikely. So far I don't think any champions that have been added officially to the champion update schedule have been iceboxed.
